intro: Oenothera victorinii f. rostanskii, commonly known as the Rostanský's evening primrose, is a rare and distinctive variant of the evening primrose genus. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to specific regions in Central Europe. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This botanical form is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique genetic traits and limited distribution.
